title: Diese Russin ist Putins wichtige Helferin: „Goebbels im Rock“
cleaned_sentences: Russia's President Vladimir Putin enjoys great power in his country.
But that is no coincidence.
His henchmen help him stay in power.
One of them is Margarita Simonjan.
She is the head of "Russia Today" and helps Putin to diligently spread his fairy tales in her broadcaster.
Putin's helper: "Goebbels in skirt" There are many helpers behind the mighty Kremlin ruler.
Margarita Simonjan is one of them.
With her television station "Russia Today" (RT), she hurls Putin's propaganda into the outside world.
Since her reports on the Chechen War at the end of the nineties, she has become an integral part of Russia's TV landscape.
In 2005 she became editor-in-chief of the Russian President of the Russian broadcaster.
++ Also interesting: Putin: Heart attack by Russian President?
Now even the Kremlin has to intervene ++ In contrast to her male colleagues, the journalist is calm on television as calm and entangled arms in the talk shows.
But there are dark intentions behind the stitch.
"It always looks very human, although she says abysmal, terrible things," said journalist Michael Thumann in the "Terra X" documentary "Putin's helper-accomplices of the Kremlin".
In some programs and conferences "Nazis" or "human -eater" she called the people in Ukraine.
At an honor, she thanked Putin that he "kills the cannibals" in Ukraine.
Dangerous propaganda channels Simonjan's broadcaster "Russia Today" describes itself as a "alternative perspective on important global events".
But there is a perfidious Kremlin propaganda: Again and again Putin's reports or reports are fake to mislead the Russian population.
The broadcaster also wants to get an effect abroad.
In 2022, 19 percent of the thesis in Germany alone agreed that NATO had provoked the Kremlin so long that Russia had to move into the Ukraine war.
More news: As part of the sanctions against Russia, the EU banned the Russian broadcaster.
Cable and satellite operators are no longer allowed to radiate RT programs in the EU, internet providers must block access to the website.
The German branch "RT German" should also be shut down.
But Simonjan always found digital loopholes to successfully bring pro-Russian content to the European audience.
